title: Efficient Multi-Vector Dense Retrieval Using Bit Vectors
abstract: arXiv:2404.02805v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Dense retrieval techniques employ pre-trained large language models to build a high-dimensional representation of queries and passages. These representations compute the relevance of a passage w.r.t. to a query using efficient similarity measures. In this line, multi-vector representations show improved effectiveness at the expense of a one-order-of-magnitude increase in memory footprint and query latency by encoding queries and documents on a per-token level. Recently, PLAID has tackled these problems by introducing a centroid-based term representation to reduce the memory impact of multi-vector systems. By exploiting a centroid interaction mechanism, PLAID filters out non-relevant documents, thus reducing the cost of the successive ranking stages. translated_title: 使用位向量进行高效的多向量密集检索
translated_abstract: 密集检索技术利用预训练的大型语言模型构建查询和段落的高维表示，使用高效的相似度措施计算段落相对于查询的相关性。最近，PLAID通过引入基于质心的术语表示来减少多向量体系的内存影响，通过利用质心交互机制，PLAID过滤出非相关文档，从而减少后续排名阶段的成本。本文提出了一种新颖的框架，名为“使用位向量进行高效的多向量密集检索”（EMVB），用于多向量密集检索中的高效查询处理。
tldr: 提出了一种新颖的框架EMVB，利用位向量实现高效的多向量密集检索，通过引入质心交互机制来减少非相关文档，降低排名阶段成本。
en_tdlr: Introduced a novel framework EMVB for efficient multi-vector dense retrieval using bit vectors, reducing non-relevant documents and lowering ranking cost by introducing centroid interaction mechanism.
